subject: Travel
title: Pavlopetri: The Oldest Underwater City
description: A fast breakdown of Pavlopetri: The Oldest Underwater City for builders.

hook.text: Off the coast of Greece lies a 5,000-year-old city submerged in just 12 feet of crystal-clear water.

buildup.text: Pavlopetri was discovered in 1967. Its streets, buildings, and tombs are perfectly visible from the surface.

discovery.text: It dates to 2800 BC, making it the oldest known submerged city. It predates the Iliad by 1,500 years.

twist.text: Earthquakes slowly sank it over centuries. Residents likely migrated gradually as waters rose.

climax.text: Swimmers and snorkelers can see it from the surface, but touching or removing anything is a crime in Greece.

punchline.text: You can see a 5,000-year-old city by snorkeling in shallow water.
